user.title: Weather Station Core -- Create Station
user.description: Give your weather station a name. The prefix will be used for all entity IDs (e.g. prefix 'ws' creates sensor.ws_temperature).

required_sources.title: Required sensors
required_sources.description: Map each required measurement to an existing sensor entity. These 7 sensors are mandatory.

optional_sources.title: Optional sensors
optional_sources.description: These sensors improve derived metrics but are not required. Leave blank to skip.

data.dew_point: Dew point (if your station provides it; otherwise it is calculated)

location.title: Location & climate
location.description: These settings affect pressure reduction, Zambretti forecast wind patterns, and seasonal logic. Elevation has been pre-filled from your Home Assistant location.

data.climate_region: Climate region (for Zambretti wind pattern weighting)

display.title: Display units
display.description: Choose how values are displayed. 'Auto' follows your Home Assistant unit system setting.

forecast.title: 7-day forecast
forecast.description: Weather Station Core can fetch a 7-day forecast from Open-Meteo (free, no API key required). Coordinates default to your Home Assistant location.

alerts.title: Alerts & advanced options
alerts.description: Configure alert thresholds and fine-tune algorithm parameters. Defaults work well for most stations.

features.title: Features
features.description: Choose which sensors to enable. Each can be toggled independently. You can change these later in Configure.

data.enable_display_sensors: Display sensors (humidity level, UV level, pressure trend, station health)
data.enable_metar: METAR cross-validation (compare local sensors vs nearest airport)
data.enable_cwop: CWOP upload (share data with Citizen Weather Observer Program)
data.enable_wunderground: Weather Underground upload (share data with Weather Underground PWS)
data.enable_export: CSV / JSON data export (save observations to file)

sea_temp.title: Sea temperature location
sea_temp.description: Coordinates for sea surface temperature lookup. Defaults to your Home Assistant location. Override if your home is inland or you want a specific coastal point.

degree_days.title: Degree Days — base temperature
degree_days.description: Heating Degree Days (HDD) and Cooling Degree Days (CDD) measure how much heating or cooling a building needs each day. The base temperature is the outdoor temperature at which no heating or cooling is required — typically 18 °C (64 °F) for residential buildings. HDD accumulates when it is colder than the base; CDD when it is warmer. Both reset at midnight.

metar.title: METAR cross-validation
metar.description: Fetches the latest aviation METAR report from the nearest airport and compares temperature and pressure against your local sensors. Free data from aviationweather.gov — no API key required. Find your nearest ICAO code at aviationweather.gov/metar. Leave the ICAO field blank to skip setup now and configure later.

data.metar_icao: Nearest airport ICAO code (e.g. LGAV for Athens)

cwop.title: CWOP upload
cwop.description: Upload observations to the Citizen Weather Observer Program (cwop.aprs.net). You need a free CWOP callsign — register at wxqa.com. Amateur radio operators use their callsign; citizens use a CW or EW callsign. Leave blank to skip and configure later.

data.cwop_callsign: CWOP callsign (e.g. CW1234 or EW1234) — leave blank to skip

wunderground.title: Weather Underground upload
wunderground.description: Upload observations to your Weather Underground Personal Weather Station. You need a station ID and API key from your Weather Underground account (wunderground.com/member/devices). Leave both fields blank to skip and configure later.

data.wu_station_id: Station ID (e.g. IATHEN123) — leave blank to skip
data.wu_api_key: API key — leave blank to skip

export.title: CSV / JSON data export
export.description: Periodically write all sensor readings to a file on your Home Assistant host. Each day gets its own file (e.g. ws_core_20260218.csv). The directory will be created automatically if it does not exist.

error.entity_not_found: Entity not found in Home Assistant.
error.not_numeric: Entity state is not a numeric value.
error.elevation_out_of_range: Elevation must be between -500 m and 9000 m.
error.wind_gust_too_high: Wind gust threshold exceeds the physical world record.
error.temp_out_of_range: Temperature is outside the physically possible range.

init.title: Weather Station Core -- Options
init.description: Update settings, units, location, forecast, and alert thresholds.

missing_source_entities.title: Weather station source entities not found
missing_source_entities.description: The following source sensor entities could not be found in Home Assistant: {entities}. Check that the sensor entities exist and are not disabled.

stale_sensors.title: Weather station sensors are stale
stale_sensors.description: The following sensors have not updated within the staleness timeout: {sensors}. Check that your weather station hardware is online and connected.

forecast_api_failures.title: Open-Meteo forecast API failures
forecast_api_failures.description: The Open-Meteo forecast API has failed {failures} consecutive times. Forecast data may be stale. Check your internet connection. The integration will retry automatically with exponential backoff.
